name: Olympian Motors
headline: Manufacturing modular electric vehicles with style
description:
Olympian Motors is an electric vehicle company, based in New York. 

We are manufacturing electric vehicles with our innovative 'modular' vehicle & drivetrain architecture (MVDS), providing Olympian with strong cost and lead-time advantages compared to legacy automakers like Tesla and Ford.

Olympian is disrupting 120+ years old automotive industry and targeting to capture 7% market share in the U.S. automotive market by 2030.

We changed the status-quo in automotive design, and bring aesthetic, color, experience and minimalism back to the cars.

Olympian MVDS has a 'Lego-like' architecture and built on 4-core-hardware and 2-software modules. We achieved 80% reduction in tooling & machinery costs and built ~60% faster production lead time.

We aim to reinvent the car manufacturing and bringing agility, speed and cost-efficiency back to the U.S. automotive industry.

+ Received 214 pre-orders for Olympian Model O1  ($17M+ pre-booked revenue)
+ Started manufacturing our EVs in Brooklyn & Detroit facilities. 2023 capacity: 320 vehicles
+ Pending traffic approval from NHTSA
+ Modular vehicle/drivetrain + Modular manufacturing: 4-hardware + 1-sofware modules. ~60% faster production lead time. 80% reduction in tooling, fitment and labor expenses. 
+ Commercial Launch in Q3/2023. Unlike other EV companies, we don't waste time/resources. (It took 9+ years for Lucid and 11+ years for Rivian to make their first shipment).
+ Super-competitive battery efficiency in urban areas (Olympian early prototypes achieved slightly better miles/kwh efficiency than Tesla Model 3 and Rivian).
+ Carbon-sequestered and recyclable materials for +4% of vehicle components.

Olympian rejects today's commoditized and banal car experience.  
+ We challenge the status-quo in automotive. 
+ We prioritize aesthetic, nature and minimalism.  
+ We use steel and wood in Olympian cars rather than not cheap plastic and toxic chemicals. 
+ We have minimalistic cockpit, powered by Olympian Operating System (OOS)
tags: industry:consumer; industry:manufacturing; industry:climate; industry:transportation; industry:electric-vehicles; location:new-york

founders.name: Jasmine Sungu, Founder
founders.description: Previously a Business Development Lead at Cisco. Prior to that, Jasmine worked at IBM & EY as a managing consultant in the automotive and mobility industry. She started her career at Merrill Lynch as a BD analyst. She holds a BA in Economics from NYU.

founders.name: Eren Canarslan, Founder
founders.description:
Building the next-generation electric vehicles at Olympian.

Prior to Olympian Motors, Eren was working at Qualcomm, focused on autonomous driving, electric vehicles and satellites. Previously, Eren worked at multiple VC funds in New York and investment banks in Europe. He started his professional career at Ford Motors R&D department as an electrical engineer. 

He holds an MBA degree from Columbia University, and a BSc Degree in Electronics Engineering.

generated_description:
**Olympian Motors: Redefining the Electric Vehicle Experience**

Founded in 2021 and set in the vibrant backdrop of New York, Olympian Motors is embarking on a bold journey to reinvent the automotive industry. Armed with an ambitious mission to manufacture modular electric vehicles with style, Olympian is poised to challenge over a century of automotive design norms.

**Innovative Modular Vehicle Design**

At the heart of Olympian’s innovation is their Modular Vehicle & Drivetrain System (MVDS), which resembles a "Lego-like" structure. By utilizing a flexible architecture based on four core hardware and two software modules, Olympian has achieved:

- **60% faster production lead times** compared to traditional automakers.
- A staggering **80% reduction in tooling and machinery costs**, giving them a significant edge in efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

This clever engineering is designed to cater to the evolving consumer preferences while addressing traditional manufacturing pain points.

**Market Ambition**

Olympian Motors has set its sights on capturing **7% of the U.S. automotive market by 2030**, effectively disrupting an industry that has seen little change in design philosophy over the last 120 years. They aim to deliver more than just vehicles; they're focused on creating an aesthetic and memorable driving experience, utilizing materials like steel and wood instead of plastics.

**Product Offerings**

Olympian has already made a splash in the market by racking up **214 pre-orders for their Model O1**, translating to over **$17 million** in pre-booked revenue. Operating facilities in Brooklyn and Detroit, they've established a manufacturing capacity of **320 vehicles for 2023**. As they prepare for a commercial launch in Q3 2023, their approach contrasts sharply with competitors, who have taken years to deliver their first vehicles.

The Model O1 and the Model 84 are flagship offerings, showcasing Olympian's commitment to style, sustainability, and performance. Each model boasts impressive ranges and integrates their proprietary **Olympian Operating System** for a seamless user experience.

**Sustainability Focus**

Sustainability plays a critical role in Olympian's ethos. They are committed to using **carbon-sequestered and recyclable materials** for over 4% of their vehicle composites. Their early prototypes demonstrate competitive battery efficiency, outperforming prominent models such as the Tesla Model 3 in urban settings.

In short, Olympian Motors isn’t just about building electric vehicles; it’s about creating a new narrative in transportation—one where aesthetics, functionality, and environmental consciousness are at the forefront. With a focused team of 10 and backed by Y Combinator's Batch W22, Olympian is ready to spearhead a movement redefining how we perceive and experience cars. 

For more information, check out their website at [Olympian Motors](https://olympianmotors.com).
